text: William B. Kristan, Jr. is an American biologist, currently the Distinguished Professor Emeritus at the University of California, San Diego. He was awarded a Ph.D by the University of Pennsylvania before becoming a postdoctoral fellow at Stanford University. He was awarded a 1981 Guggenheim Fellowship and was a Fellow of the University of Bielefeld, Germany. His interests are in the behaviour of neuronal networks and their creation during embryogenesis. using a variety of advanced techniques to examine the circuits in the relatively controllable nervous system of the medicinal leech. ==References== Category:University of California, San Diego faculty Category:21st-century American biologists Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: William Kristan
